place.name: REYNOLDSTON
place.gazetteerText: REYNOLDSTON, a parish in Swansea district, Glamorgan; in the Gower peninsula, under Cefn-Bryn, 7¾ miles S W of Loughor r. station, and 12 W S W of Swansea. It has a post-office under Swansea. Acres, 1,047. Real property, £863. Pop., 270. Houses, 63. The manor belonged to Reginald de Braose. Stout Hall is achief residence. There is a large cave. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £120. Patron,R. M. Talbot, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
